title: [Large-scale] Instructional Strategies for Students with Learning Disabilities Using Working Memory-Sensitive Math Interventions

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of learning disability characteristics, foundational mathematics education methodologies, and working memory theory
context.additional_context: Process for pre-service/in-service teachers to acquire and apply practical strategies for improving math abilities in students with learning disabilities. Combines self-directed learning using personal devices with face-to-face workshop sessions

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the correlation between working memory characteristics and mathematics learning and apply it to instructional design.
Learners can design a 10-session, 30-minute mathematics intervention program considering the cognitive limitations of students with learning disabilities.
Learners can measure the effectiveness of the intervention program through formative assessment and develop supplementary strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
